Ok, so as someone who has over 200 hours and has "completed" the main story quests up to the end of the Shadowbringers expansion as well have done a good amount of the raids and trials both extreme and normal difficulties i believe i can safely write this review. 
Firstly, the Character creation is very good, the races are nice the customization is there yada yada. The classes, though difficult to understand at first, are all extremely in depth and well designed. They are interesting and each class feels different enough to fill it's own specific niche. A major positive for the game in my opinion. The other awesome benefit is you can level every single class and skill on a single character. You do not need to create dozens of characters to find the job you enjoy most. Dungeons though bland at first, are still very fun and unique, and there are enough of them to fill hours and hours of game time. Another big plus, is that (with a cash shop purchase) MAJORITY of the main story quests are able to be skipped. I'll explain why this is such a big plus later on. 
The jobs are fun and the cosmetic options the game provides you are very nice (both cash shop and otherwise). Dyes are not intrusive or difficult to apply. 
Now i confess I have not been able to purchase a player home as of yet, because they are so difficult to come by. This is a negative for me, as player homes are essentially sparse and you have to be very lucky and rich to acquire the necessary land to build one. However, the fact that player housing is even an option is still very nice. 
Ok so big negative for me is the story. I find the MSQ (Main Story Quest) of this game to be utterly intrusive, annoying, and unfun. That is why i used the cash shop skip for a large majority of the quests. That is not to say the entire story is bad. I played through about 1/4 of Realm Reborn, all of Heavensward, and all of Shadowbringers. The problem is the MSQ feels like a very boring chore that nobody wants to do. You will spend literal hours running back and forth between NPC"s (half of which are telling you the exact same thing)  and just rack up exp. It is boring and blande. Additionally, understand, YOU ARE NOT THE MAIN CHARACTER! Alphinaud, Cid, and all the other "Main NPCS" are the main characters, you are just putting in the work as the "warrior or light" blah blah. It is frustrating. I HIGHLY reccommend that you skip as much of the story as you can and simply play through the dungeons to level your characters. 
Now of course, this does come from the perspective of someone who has never played another FInal fantasy game. So it is entirely possible the story is not to my taste, and that is totally fine if you choose to play through it. I just don't think it's very good. 
Overall, the game is very very good. The classes are a massive strong point, each being very unique and intriguing to pick up and learn, and all fill a niche. Additionally, dungeon design and raids and trials are all very fun to do. I would very highly recommend this game outside of the MSQ, which thankfully you can pay to skip. If that is not worth it to you then enjoy! But be warned, it is tedious, especially since the game locks content such as dungeons and trials (the fun stuff imo) behind the tedious main story. Other than that, the game is a solid 8/10 for me! Enjoy!

Fun.. but watch your wallet folks, they will rob you blind if you dont pay attention.  For example, if your new, or have a new account, Shadowbringers purchase will give you 30 days of playtime.  If you're a returning player and need Shadowbringers to continue with your friends or what not, guess what? You pay the $44 (after taxes) AND you get to pay for the month as well.  

Now.. while not reprehensible, that is a pretty cheap underhanded business model.  Not one I'm sure I want to support.  Thus I need to decide if I want a refund before logging in again, and then having to tell my guild that I'll not be re-joining them because I refuse to support this sort of underhanded business practice.  

Have some respect for your consumers SE.  We are not simply wallets for you to empty.  You make a good game, but you don't need to screw us over to get your props.

Pros:

x Unlike most MMO's, this game is NOT pay to win.  
x Fun community, met a lot of fun people. It's the first community in a game where everyone just has fun together, no one is excluded.

Okay, first ever review of a game lol... Hmm, where to even start? So, I... liked it. It was fun, especially with friends, this game really does encourage you to have four people, but me and my bud got along with two, using the random folks from the internet for our other squad members lol. 

And... hmm, liked the combat in the early game, later it gets super weird though, having to research all the differing attacks, buffs, and other things you get. The character customization is really nice, first real avatar of mine that I've liked, even roleplaying as her for a bit lol! 

But hmm, I can't think of much more positives, let's get into mixed before the negatives lol. So money. You won't have that. At least really early on, cause yeah, it's pretty hard to get when most items sell for one gil. And while you could craft, that's mostly just mindless. And EXP is very similar, enemies in the overworld feel like a chore to get through, and the amount of levels you need for them to not aggro you is 11 or higher. I get they don't want you to explore too much, especially as a new player, but 11 is way too many, especially at how long grinding takes late-game. 

Hmm, and let's just mention Quests, Fates, Levequests, and anything else like that. Because, while I love the recommendations option, always telling you all the quests in an area, any monsters you need to kill for your hunting log, etc... But if you're like me, who completes everything, all that will be left is Levequests, and FATEs. Solo, FATEs are impossible, don't even try. It takes forever for the swarms, and if it's a big boss, that's basically an instant loss, you can't defeat it alone. Which I get, it's MMO, but a major source of grinding is just lost to the people who play solo, or split off from their friends due to differing classes, etc... So all that's left is Levequests, which are tedious. Do the same mission, get a small percentage of EXP for your next level, rinse and repeat. The main quests and side quests are amazing though, just fun to do, give good Gil and EXP, I wish there were more of those! But as someone who's basically done everything in every area so far, yeah, it's not too pleasant to just do the same missions over and over again. Also, those side quests are shared across every class, so if you ever wanna switch, good luck getting your new one to a high enough level to even challenge the remaining quests, or grind at levequests! Because, yeah, those are the only remaining source of EXP, monsters give nothing, dungeons are locked at level 15, and all your main ways of getting levels have been done by the prior class! Just, yeah, this isn't fun to grind in, no, scratch that, it is fun to grind in, just all the fun ways are one time things!

Now, biggest thing I'm disappointed by. The actual story itself. I am only just about done the main game, all the quests are level 50 now, and... while it did make a slight upward swing towards it's end, the game's just lacking. Like, yeah, I tried, I really did try to get invested in all the characters, all the lore, everything but... No, it didn't happen. Okay, let me try to explain without spoilers... 

The one bit I actually liked were your job quests, the things you take to learn new class skills. Those are really fun, have their own mini stories, and are pretty specific to each class, and in turn, your character. They all end right when you promote too, each arc wrapping up nicely and it truly feels like you did something that mattered. Too bad they're stuck behind level caps, meaning if you wanna see 'em all, that means more grinding via levequests! Yay... But those stories are good, the issue is...

The main story sucks. The group you eventually become a part of is rather disconnected from you except for the occasional appearance in a main quest, plus the one you are "close" with is entirely reliant on your town, which that itself is reliant on your class. So, you have your main group person, that you can't really choose, unless you waste the ten early-game levels for a specific town, and then you have the people who are just in the story no matter what you do. Let's make this quick, Town leaders suck, leader of the group is cute but no real personality, and villains? If there is a single villain who you can remember the name of, I will be impressed. Like wow, the "conflict" in this story is so non-existent lol. The only reason you play it is for the EXP! Because yeah, it gives a ton, so you're gonna play it to unlock things and all, but... will you remember it? Is it an experience that really wows you? Like this is my first time really playing a Final Fantasy, kings of the RPG genre, and this is the story I get? Like, for real?

Okay, there's one character I like. You meet them late-game, they have amnesia, if you played the game, you know who I'm talking about, I think. They're cool, really liked any scene with them in it, felt like an actual person in this RPG, who'd have thunk that's an accomplishment lol? 

But yeah, I know I've been harsh, complaining is really easy, but if you have four friends who can be active consistently? Yeah, this game is a no-brainer. There's some really fun things here, but I think that may be because this is my first real experience with the genre lol. And there's so many hidden systems that I'm sure I missed, but this game does have awful tutorials and like the smallest text size known to man... Hey, the world's lively, if you know how online interaction works, you may be able to make some friends here! 

But as for me? It's tough, cause the stuff that works really does work lol. Hunting specific enemies, completing recommendations, doing the job quests, character customization, learning how to actually be good in your class, this all feels really fun. 

The downsides are also quite large though, inability to successfully switch classes, meaning you are locked to one for the base game, usually the starting one, which probably won't be your best fit. The whole town system, making starting at the same place with friends either impossible or one of you will probably have to be have to change classes to do dungeons, which also sucks. The unfairness of single player grinding, there being no way to do solo dungeons, Fates, or any other forms of multiplayer grind methods, leaving only Levequests left, especially if you completed all the side stuff in an area. The main story (at least for the base game, the DLC may be perfection incarnate, who knows?) absolutely being an absolute bore, your main character sticking out like a sore thumb, and every other person being either uninteresting or devoid of any real personality/struggles, except for one main person and a couple NPCs. 

Just... yeah, it has to be a no for me, to my past self, at least for the $60 + over a hundred in subscription fees. You aren't going to find those amazing characters you hoped for, the plot is basically a generic RPG one, just worse by no party members, cool villains, actual overworld changes, or any real stakes. It's fun, but not almost three full priced games worth of it. There's many good bits, countless fun moments too, but that's all occasional gameplay, having fun with your online friend, and getting to make a cute girl. There are far better games that provide these things, and are just better.

To end this off, you have four friends, can play regularly, and just are really not looking for a good story? Yeah, this works. Try and beat it by under $100, it definitely isn't worth that much. In fact, just don't get the DLC until after you beat the main game. Maybe it can be $60 at that point, but even at that price? 7.5/10, minus a point for every $20 extra. So... 2.5/10 for me, but still would recommend. You just have to play it fast, have low expectations, and preferably have people to play with. So yeah, give it a shot if you think that applies, if not...? Well, I told you my story lol. Hope it helps lol!

TL/DR: Played 15h in my Free Trial, Came back after 1 Year to become addicted!


Oh, here is the Window for this.
Ok, so I never in my Life wrote a Review for something, but I guess there is a first Time for everything as they say.
I originally started last Year for a short 10-15h to see what the Game was about.
Back then, I played all of that Time in 2 Sittings. So I knew I would "Burn out" eventually.
Hence, I lay the Game aside for some Time.
So, I believe 20 Days from writing this I started playing the Game again, and just now realized,
I played for an average of 13h a Day. And Truth be Told, I don't regret it. I mean, I don´t understand the Game at all.
It has So many Possibilities on how you can Play it, that it may seem overwhelming.
But I found a few Friends without even Trying.I loved the Questing, until I ran out of Quests/SIdequests.
Now I spend most of my Day grinding Fates and trying to find the Perfect Class for my Playstyle.
It doesn't matter what kind of Gamer you are.
The Grinder, Min-maxing everything.
The Farmer, Chopping Wood or Hitting Ores.
The Mobber, who all he does is Kill Mobs´.
The RP-Player, sitting in Towns in "RP" Mode all day interacting with People.
The Fashionist, trying to get that Perfect Look to make other People jealous.
Etc. etc., etc.
This Game has something for everyone.
And even if you do not Like/understand something at first. You do not need all of these Things.
This is the first Game since a very long Time having me come back every Day and enjoying every second of my Time spent.

Hopped into the game and was immediately met with a concert where a bunch of players were playing instruments perfectly in sync while a bunch of people were sitting and watching. It was a wild experience to see a game where players could actually play instruments in sync, and play popular songs from different shows/anime/etc. We were then peddled around by a bunch of level 60s in weird flying mounts to complete our quests around the land. The MMO and RPG experience is definitely strong with this game, and I think I will be sticking around :).

The best way to explain this game.

It's a theme park. Getting in might take a bit but there is so much stuff to do and it's all so different.
* Grind for top tier PvE gear
* Play dress up and get the perfect Ronald McKnight cosplay
* Bite sized PvP matches with friends
* Triple Triad matches with a little goblin man
* Joining a RP Free Company and acting out the drama!
* Playing the market and getting so much gil you don't know what to do with it
* Becoming a potato and killing a God again

My favorite game in the series, and one of my favorites overall too. Great story and graphics. I normally hate paying a subscription for anything, but here it's obvious the money's going back into the game.

(disclaimer: my first actual review so bear with me.)

I've played many fantasy games and MMOs over the years, but i would say this is my favourite. It may take a while to get started story and combat pacing-wise, as you don't have many abilities at first, but as you level up, it gets more and more engaging. 
The story grew on me over time, and the story comes into its own by the start of Heavensward, and only goes up from there. I went from being bored to feeling genuine emotion with the characters and tearing up at points. I would say try the free trial and see if you like the game, as it goes upto level 60 and the end of the first expansion, Heavensward. 
I would say with the upcoming Endwalker expansion later this year, it is one of the best times to start playing this wonderful game.

I would give this game a 10/10 for the amazing story and fun gameplay, and say it is my favourite game.

Overall, the story might come off as bland and slow, but quickly pieces together a very interesting world. The game play up until around level 30-50 is quite slow and will leave you pressing the same few buttons over and over again but ramps up quickly to an almost insane pace at late game keeping those interested in having to manage global cooldowns and oGCDs while dodging attacks in quick paced beautiful fights. 

The PvP is a chaotic mess, but truly enjoyable if you're able to take the reins of around 50 players in your team and have them work together to overcome your opponents with strategic timing and good positioning, usually hard, but fun nonetheless as you use spells otherwise much more harder to access in this combat against other players. 

Music is a absolutely amazing from minute one of the game.

UI-HUD- is made extra manageable with Macros to activate and deactivate menus and hud elements with ease, as well as repositioning or resizing in the UI manager.

My Dearest Martha,

I need to tell you about my time in Final Fantasy XIV. At first it was enjoyable enough, lots of quests meeting various fantastical characters and bringing items from one person to another. I was having fun, but it was undeniably something I had done in many MMO games over the years. Over time though I became immersed in this fantasy world. I started to "get" what set this MMO above others. In a word, it's just fun.

This game is less worried about bringing people together to bang their heads against the walls of multiplayer content. It would rather tell a large sweeping story where your character is the protagonist and a story that can be enjoyed with others as well.

It was a slow start, but by the time I had made it to the first expansion I was hooked.

Oh and the dragons in it are way better than the dragons in ESO. That's just a fact.

I hope this letter finds you well Martha. I don't suspect I shall see Little Timmy, Sally, John, Leviticus, or yourself again. My fight is in Eorzea now, and I must needs remain here.

Yours in this life and the next,
Revendawn

FFXIV:ARR is an all round fantastic MMORPG that implements some new systems that I personally haven't seen in any other MMORPG. I am a longtime WoW player and decided to give this MMORPG a go due to WoW kind of getting boring (thats a personal opinion) and I am glad i did give this MMORPG a shot, the graphics, the gameplay, the classes, the story etc everything about this game feels fresh to me and i am loving the adventure ive been on. 10/10 in my opinion. Don't get me wrong it's definitely not perfect lets be real like every other game it has its downfalls but, again, in my opinion i feel like its a game that has the smallest or least amount of negatives then any other game out there. If your looking for something fresh and different i highly recommend giving this game a try, best part about this game its completely FREE TO PLAY up until level 60 which is LITERALLY the entire base game and im fairly certain the first expansion completely FREE with the free trial, so why not give it a try? if you dont like it delete, if you do then purchase it!

This game is saving me so much money from impulse buys. 9/10

Game's story starts off pretty slow and rampant in fetch quests, but turns to one of the most engrossing Final Fantasy stories of all time. The story is accentuated with its myriad of nuanced villains, and its wonderful world building. 

The class/Job system is pretty damn great. All classes can be played on one character, making it so much easier to experience all the roles and all the combat system has to offer in enjoyment. You're a tank main who wants to try healer role? Easy peezy, just switch.

The base game and first expansion is free for all to try with no time limit, Easily a 100 hour free experience.

I got 777 hours played in this game, running end game content and leveling other classes. I still feel like there's a loot of game left for me to experience.
